RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the papers: papers necessary to dispose of the motion

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: governs the timing of trials, including exclusions for certain periods
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pretrial motion: motion filed before trial, subject to exclusions under the Speedy Trial Act
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.hearing on the motion: proceeding where evidence is presented regarding the pretrial motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.post-hearing briefs: submissions made after the hearing on the motion, necessary for the court's disposition
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that rules on pretrial motions and applies the Speedy Trial Act
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.papers necessary to dispose of the motio: documents required for the court to rule on the pretrial motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.thirty-day exclusion period: exclusion period under the Speedy Trial Act, during which the clock is stopped
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.statutory exclusions: periods excluded from the Speedy Trial Act's time calculations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act clock: mechanism for tracking time under the Speedy Trial Act, including start and stop times
